author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother, exploring themes of surveillance, censorship, and the loss of individuality.

title: Eat That Frog!
author: Brian Tracy
description: A productivity guide offering 21 practical steps to stop procrastinating and get more done by tackling the most important tasks first.

title: Demian
author: Hermann Hesse
description: A coming-of-age novel that explores duality, identity, and the inner spiritual journey of a young man guided by a mysterious figure named Demian.

title: Dopamine Nation
author: Anna Lembke
description: An exploration of addiction, pleasure, and pain in modern society, offering insights on how to find balance in a dopamine-saturated world.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A brief history of humankind, tracing the evolution of Homo sapiens from the Stone Age to the modern era.

title: Why We Sleep
author: Matthew Walker
description: A comprehensive examination of the science of sleep and its critical role in physical and mental health.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A proven framework for building good habits and breaking bad ones through small daily improvements.

title: The Bible
author: Multiple Authors
description: The sacred scriptures of Christianity, composed of the Old and New Testaments, encompassing history, poetry, prophecy, and moral teachings.

title: The Charisma Myth
author: Olivia Fox Cabane
description: A guide to understanding and developing personal charisma using science-based techniques.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller centered on a woman who becomes entangled in a missing persons investigation after witnessing something suspicious during her commute.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical story about a shepherd named Santiago who dreams of finding a treasure and discovers deeper meaning and destiny along the way.

title: The Witcher: The Last Wish
author: Andrzej Sapkowski
description: A collection of short stories introducing Geralt of Rivia, a monster hunter for hire in a world of magic, mystery, and moral ambiguity.

title: Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life
author: Héctor García & Francesc Miralles
description: Explores the Japanese concept of 'ikigai', or a reason for being, and how it can lead to a fulfilled and meaningful life.

title: The Call of Cthulhu
author: H.P. Lovecraft
description: A chilling tale of cosmic horror and madness, following the investigation of an ancient cult that worships an alien god.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
description: A personal finance classic comparing two perspectives on money, investing, and wealth-building: one from his real dad and one from his friend's wealthy father.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: An ancient Chinese military treatise offering timeless strategies for warfare, leadership, and tactical thinking.

title: The 48 Laws of Power
author: Robert Greene
description: A powerful guide to manipulation, influence, and strategic thinking drawn from historical figures and political maneuvering.

title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
author: Mark Twain
description: A coming-of-age story about a mischievous boy growing up along the Mississippi River, full of humor and adventure.

title: The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe
author: Daniel Defoe
description: The story of a castaway who survives for years on a remote island using ingenuity, resilience, and survival skills.
